definition: to bring trouble on oneself
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to suffer as a consequence of one's own actions/you asked for it/to bring it on oneself (sth unpleasant)
to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
to reap what one has sown (idiom)/to stew in one's own juice
to ask for trouble/to bring misfortune on oneself
disaster one brings on oneself/to be reponsible for something bad that happens to oneself/to have only oneself to blame
to move a stone and stub one's toe/to shoot oneself in the foot (idiom)

definition: to dig one's own grave
(coll.) to go through sheer hell
why bother?/is it worth the trouble?
to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
(coll.) to look for trouble
to overestimate one's capabilities (idiom)
